<p>Culture media described here are the most common routinely used ones for specific pathogens. There are as many media as there are bacteria. A book of this nature cannot deal with all of them.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="media-for-anaerobes">MEDIA FOR ANAEROBES<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#media-for-anaerobes" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="cooked-meat-medium-robertson-s">Cooked Meat Medium (Robertson's)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#cooked-meat-medium-robertson-s" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<p>Cooked meat medium is an excellent enrichment medium used for the rapid growth and maintenance of bacteria, especially anaerobes. The meat contains reducing substances which provide anaerobic condition at the bottom of the tube, and it prevents convectional currents. The medium also detects saccharolytic action (acid and gas production with reddening of the meat) and proteolytic action (decomposition with blackening of meat) of bacteria. Aerobes grow near the surface of the medium.</p>
<p>The Oxoid cooked meat medium incorporates glucose and sodium chloride.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="procedure-oxoid-dehydrated-medium">Procedure (Oxoid dehydrated medium)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#procedure-oxoid-dehydrated-medium" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ol>
<li>Place approximately 0.8g of cooked meat particles in screw-capped universal containers.</li>
<li>Add 10ml distilled water to each container.</li>
<li>Autoclave at 121°C for 15 minutes.</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="from-raw-material">From raw material<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#from-raw-material" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ol>
<li>Boil 500 g of minced ox heart in 500 ml 0.05N NaOH</li>
<li>Drain off fluid and partially dry the meat with a clean cloth. Adjust pH to 7.8.</li>
<li>Fill screw-capped universal containers with the meat to a depth of 12 mm.</li>
<li>Add 10 ml nutrient broth to each container.</li>
<li>Autoclave at 121°C for 15 minutes.</li>
</ol>
<p>&gt; <strong>Note:</strong> The 0.05N NaOH neutralises the lactic acid present in the meat.</p>
<p>Scanned by CamScanner</p>
<p>836 Bacteriology</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="thioglycollate-broth-brewer-s-broth">Thioglycollate Broth (Brewer's Broth)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#thioglycollate-broth-brewer-s-broth" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>This medium contains two reducing substances—glucose and sodium thioglycollate. The glucose is the main reducing agent while the thioglycollate maintains the anaerobic condition. The Oxoid formula of this medium incorporates L-cystine and yeast extract as extra enrichments, and uses resazurin instead of the original methylene blue as indicator because the former is found to be less inhibitory. In the absence of air (oxygen), the medium is colourless but pink (or blue in the original formula) when oxidised. It is prepared as sloppy agar medium because it contains about 0.5% agar to prevent convectional currents.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="procedure-oxoid">Procedure (Oxoid)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#procedure-oxoid" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ol>
<li>Add 14.75g of dehydrated medium to 500 ml distilled water.</li>
<li>Allow to dissolve</li>
<li>Dispense in 20 ml amounts into universal containers that have screw-caps with central holes and rubber linings.</li>
<li>Autoclave with the caps loosened, at 121°C for 15 minutes.</li>
<li>Allow to cool, tighten the caps and cover each top with a foil cap or Viscap soaked in 70% alcohol.</li>
<li>Store in a cool dark place.</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="lactose-egg-yolk-milk-agar">Lactose-Egg-Yolk-Milk Agar<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#lactose-egg-yolk-milk-agar" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>This medium is used for the growth and identification of the <em>Clostridium</em> species. It detects lactose fermentation, lipase activity and lecithinase production. The medium can be made selective for <em>Clostridium perfringens</em> by the addition of 250 µg/ml of neomycin sulphate.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="procedure">Procedure<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#procedure" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ol>
<li>Prepare egg-yolk suspension by aseptically mixing equal volumes of egg yolk and sterile normal saline.</li>
<li>Skimmed milk</li>
</ol>
<p>Reconstitute the skimmed milk powder in sterile water. Bring to the boil, and allow to cool before using it.</p>
<table><thead><tr><th>Nutrient agar</th><th>400 ml</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>Lactose</td><td>4.8 g</td></tr><tr><td>1% Neutral red solution</td><td>1.3 ml</td></tr><tr><td>Sterilise at 115°C for 10 minutes.</td><td></td></tr><tr><td>Cool to 50°C and add:</td><td></td></tr><tr><td>Egg-yolk suspension</td><td>15 ml</td></tr><tr><td>Sterile skimmed milk</td><td>60 ml</td></tr><tr><td>Mix well</td><td></td></tr><tr><td>Pour plates immediately.</td><td></td></tr><tr><td>Store media in the refrigerator.</td><td></td></tr></tbody></table>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="gentamicin-blood-agar">Gentamicin Blood Agar<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#gentamicin-blood-agar" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Refer to selective blood agar media.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="culture-media-for-bordetella-pertusis">CULTURE MEDIA FOR BORDETELLA PERTUSIS<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#culture-media-for-bordetella-pertusis" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="1-bordet-gengou-medium">1. Bordet-Gengou Medium<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#1-bordet-gengou-medium" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<p>This is a selective medium for <em>Bordetella pertusis</em> and it is available commercially as dehydrated medium. The agar base is a 25–30% blood agar. The constituents of the agar base are:</p>
<table><thead><tr><th>Potato extract</th><th>2.75 g</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>Proteose peptone</td><td>5.0 g</td></tr><tr><td>Sodium chloride</td><td>2.75 g</td></tr><tr><td>Agar</td><td>8 g</td></tr><tr><td>1% Glycerol in distilled water</td><td>350 ml</td></tr><tr><td>pH</td><td>6.7</td></tr><tr><td>Cephalexin</td><td>20 mg</td></tr></tbody></table>
<p>&gt; <strong>Note</strong>
&gt; Penicillin was used in the original formula but it has now been replaced with Cephalexin which is available in a lyophilised form in a vial and labelled Bordetella selective supplement. Add 2 ml of sterile distilled water to a vial and allow contents to dissolve completely.</p>
<p>Scanned by CamScanner</p>
<p>Formulae and Preparation of Culture Media 837</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="preparation">Preparation<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#preparation" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>Bordet-Gengou agar base (Oxoid) 350 ml</li>
<li>Sterilise at 121°C for 15 minutes</li>
<li>Allow to cool to 50°C.</li>
<li>Rehydrated supplement 1 vial</li>
<li>Defibrinated horse blood 150 ml</li>
<li>Mix well and pour about 30–40 ml (i.e. double thickness) into each petri dish.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="2-charcoal-cephalexin-blood-agar-ccba-for-bordetella">2. Charcoal, Cephalexin Blood Agar (CCBA) for Bordetella<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#2-charcoal-cephalexin-blood-agar-ccba-for-bordetella" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>CCBA is a good selective medium for Bordetella species. The dehydrated medium contains Charcoal agar Distilled water Cephalexin (40mg/l) which is in lyophilised form. One vial contains 20mg of cephalexin; and is reconstituted with 2 ml of sterile distilled water.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="preparation">Preparation<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#preparation" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>Charcoal agar 25.5 g</li>
<li>Distilled water 450 ml</li>
<li>Sterilise at 121°C for 15 minutes</li>
<li>Allow to cool to 50°C</li>
<li>Rehydrated supplement 1 vial</li>
<li>Defibrinated blood 50 ml</li>
<li>Mix gently but well, and pour plates.</li>
</ul>
<p>&gt; <strong>Note</strong>: The CCBA can be used as a transport medium for Bordetella when it is prepared at half strength, i.e. 12.75g agar to 450 ml distilled water with the same amount of supplement and blood. It is then dispensed in 3–4 ml amounts in bijou bottles.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="9bfc6f3f">♦ CULTURE MEDIA FOR BRUCELLA<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#9bfc6f3f" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="1-serum-dextrose-agar">1. Serum-Dextrose Agar<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#1-serum-dextrose-agar" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<p>This is an enriched but non-selective medium for Brucella species. The Brucella medium base is composed of nutrient agar, sodium chloride and dextrose; pH 7.5.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="preparation">Preparation<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#preparation" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>Brucella medium base (oxoid) 22.5 g</li>
<li>Distilled water 500 ml</li>
<li>Bring to boil to dissolve completely.</li>
<li>Sterilise at 121°C for 15 minutes</li>
<li>Cool to 50°C</li>
<li>Add sterile 25 ml of horse serum, inactivated at 56°C for 30 minutes.</li>
<li>Mix well and pour plates.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="2-selective-medium-for-brucella">2. Selective Medium for Brucella<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#2-selective-medium-for-brucella" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>This medium is ideal for the isolation of Brucella species from milk. The selective supplement is available in lyophilised state and contains the following antibiotics per vial:</p>
<table><thead><tr><th>Polymyxin B</th><th>5,000 IU/litre</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>Bacitracin</td><td>25,000 IU/litre</td></tr><tr><td>Cycloheximide</td><td>50 mg/litre</td></tr><tr><td>Nalidixic acid</td><td>5 mg/litre</td></tr><tr><td>Nystatin</td><td>100,000 IU/litre</td></tr><tr><td>Vancomycin</td><td>10 mg/litre</td></tr></tbody></table>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="preparation">Preparation<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#preparation" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<p><strong>Reconstitute selective supplement</strong> To 1 vial add 10 ml of a 50:50 methanol and distilled water mixture to form a suspension.</p>
<p>To 500 ml of sterile Brucella medium base, cooled to 50°C add 25–50 ml inactivated horse serum and add the contents of 1 vial of selective supplement. Mix well and pour plates.</p>
<p>&gt; <strong>Note</strong>: Blood agar base plus 5–10% inactivated horse serum and 1%w/v sterile dextrose can also be used to prepare the medium.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="ae2682d5">♦ CULTURE MEDIA FOR CAMPYLOBACTER SPECIES<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#ae2682d5" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Blood agar base is made selective for Campylobacter by the addition of selective supplements. There are three commonly used supplements: Skirrow, Butzler, Blaser-Wang. They are all lyophilised antibiotic supplements contained in</p>
<p>Scanned by CamScanner</p>
<p>838 Bacteriology</p>
<p>vials. The contents of each are sufficient for 500 ml of medium.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="1-skirrow-selective-supplement-contains-per-vial">1. Skirrow Selective Supplement Contains per vial<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#1-skirrow-selective-supplement-contains-per-vial" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<table><thead><tr><th>Vancomycin</th><th>-</th><th>10 mg/litre</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>Polymyxin B</td><td>-</td><td>2,500 IU/litre</td></tr><tr><td>Trimethoprim</td><td>-</td><td>5 mg/litre</td></tr></tbody></table>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="2-butzler-selective-supplement-contains-per-vial">2. Butzler Selective Supplement Contains per vial<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#2-butzler-selective-supplement-contains-per-vial" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<table><thead><tr><th>Trimethoprim</th><th>-</th><th>5 mg/litre.</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>Bacitracin</td><td>-</td><td>25,000 units/litre</td></tr><tr><td>Cycloheximide</td><td>-</td><td>50 mg/litre</td></tr><tr><td>Colistin sulphate</td><td>-</td><td>10,000 units/litre</td></tr><tr><td>Cephazolin sodium</td><td>-</td><td>15 mg/litre</td></tr><tr><td>Novobiocin</td><td>-</td><td>5 mg/litre</td></tr></tbody></table>
<p>This selective supplement has a selective action at 37°C unlike the others where incubation has to be at 42°C. Those strains that do not grow at 42°C are selectively isolated.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="3-blaser-wang-selective-supplement-contains-per-vial">3. Blaser-Wang Selective Supplement Contains per vial<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#3-blaser-wang-selective-supplement-contains-per-vial" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<table><thead><tr><th>Trimethoprim</th><th>-</th><th>5 mg/litre</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>Vancomycin</td><td>-</td><td>10 mg/litre</td></tr><tr><td>Polymyxin B</td><td>-</td><td>2,500 IU/litre</td></tr><tr><td>Amphotericin B</td><td>-</td><td>2 mg/litre</td></tr><tr><td>Cephalothin</td><td>-</td><td>15 mg/litre</td></tr></tbody></table>
<p>The Blaser-Wang selective supplement is based on the formulation of Skirrow but with the addition of amphotericin B and cephalothin which inhibits the growth of <em>Candida albicans</em> and improves the selectivity of the supplement respectively.</p>
<p><strong>Procedure</strong> Reconstitute the selective supplement with 2 ml of sterile distilled water and mix gently to dissolve.</p>
<p><strong>Preparation of laked horse blood</strong> Place a bottle of horse blood in the freezer (–20°C) overnight.</p>
<p><strong>Preparation of complete medium</strong> Remove the frozen blood prior to pouring plates and thaw rapidly in the 50°C water bath.</p>
<p>Blood agar base 500 ml
Sterilise at 121°C for 15 minutes
Cool to 50°C
Campylobacter selective supplement 1 vial
Laked horse blood 25 ml
Mix well and pour plates</p>
<p>&gt; <strong>Note</strong>
&gt; Blood can also be laked by adding 0.5 ml of 10% sterile saponin to 10 ml blood. Saponin is sterilised at 115°C for 15 minutes.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="994e66c8">♦ CULTURE MEDIA FOR CLOSTRIDIUM SPECIES<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#994e66c8" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Most Clostridium organisms will grow on the culture media for anaerobes. Routinely, most of them are isolated with such antibiotic blood agar as Gentamicin blood and Neomycin blood agar (10 µg/ml) as described in this chapter.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="6982ad6b">♦ CULTURE MEDIA FOR CORYNEBACTERIA<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#6982ad6b" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="37dc0879">1. Hoyle’s Medium<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#37dc0879" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<p>This is a selective medium for the isolation of <em>Corynebacterium diphtheriae</em>. It consists of blood agar plus potassium tellurite which inhibits most other organisms, especially the Gram positive ones. Laked horse blood is used to enrich the medium.</p>
<p><strong>Procedure</strong> Preparation of potassium tellurite solution:</p>
<table><thead><tr><th>Potassium tellurite</th><th>0.7 g</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>Distilled water</td><td>20 ml</td></tr></tbody></table>
<p>Steam for 30 minutes and store, tightly-stopped, in the refrigerator. It can keep for up to six months. It is at 3.5% w/v concentration.</p>
<p><strong>Hoyle’s medium</strong></p>
<table><thead><tr><th>Blood agar base</th><th>100 ml</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>pH 7.8</td><td></td></tr><tr><td>Sterilise at 121°C for 15 minutes</td><td></td></tr><tr><td>Cool to 50°C</td><td></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p>Scanned by CamScanner</p>
<p>Formulae and Preparation of Culture Media 839</p>
<p>Laked horse blood 5 ml
3.5% potassium tellurite
Mix well and pour plates.
1 ml</p>
<p><strong>Note:</strong> Downe's medium is the same as above except that it employs unlinked blood.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="loeffler-s-serum-slope-medium">Loeffler's Serum Slope Medium<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#loeffler-s-serum-slope-medium" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Loeffler's serum slope medium is used to culture <em>Corynebacterium diphtheriae</em> to demonstrate volutin granules. The organism forms colonies faster on this medium than other respiratory flora. It is therefore, useful for its isolation from clinical specimens.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="procedure">Procedure<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#procedure" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Ox serum 3 parts
1% Glucose broth 1 part</p>
<ol>
<li>Sterilise the glucose broth by
(i) Autoclaving at 115°C for 15 minutes,
(ii) Seitz filteration or
(iii) Tyndallisation</li>
<li>Sterilise the serum by Seitz filteration.</li>
<li>Mix and dispense aseptically in 2.5 ml amounts into sterile bijou bottles.</li>
<li>Inspissate at 75°C until the medium has set.</li>
<li>Next day, inspissate the medium for 1 hour.</li>
<li>Store in the refrigerator.</li>
</ol>
<p><strong>Note:</strong> There is always a small quantity of water of condensation left in the medium.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="elek-s-medium-for-the-production-of-toxin-by-corynebacteria">Elek's Medium for the Production of Toxin by Corynebacteria<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#elek-s-medium-for-the-production-of-toxin-by-corynebacteria" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="solution-1">Solution 1<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#solution-1" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<table><thead><tr><th>Proteose peptone</th><th>4 g</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>Maltose</td><td>0.6 g</td></tr><tr><td>Lactic acid</td><td>0.14 g</td></tr><tr><td>Distilled water</td><td>100 ml</td></tr><tr><td>Adjust pH to 7.8.</td><td></td></tr></tbody></table>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="solution-2">Solution 2<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#solution-2" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<table><thead><tr><th>Agar powder</th><th>3 g</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>Sodium chloride</td><td>1 g</td></tr><tr><td>Distilled water</td><td>100 ml</td></tr></tbody></table>
<p>Dissolve ingredients with gentle heat. Adjust pH to 7.8 and filter.</p>
<ol>
<li>Mix equal parts of solutions 1 and 2 and dispense in 10 ml amounts.</li>
<li>Sterilise by steaming on three consecutive days.</li>
<li>For use: Melt 10 ml medium, cool to 50°C and add 2 ml of sterile calf serum. Pour plate.</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="culture-media-for-enteric-bacteria-and-other-gram-negative-bacilli">CULTURE MEDIA FOR ENTERIC BACTERIA AND OTHER GRAM NEGATIVE BACILLI<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#culture-media-for-enteric-bacteria-and-other-gram-negative-bacilli" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Bacteria isolated from stool or urine may or may not ferment lactose. Special media are used to selectively isolate and differentiate pathogenic bacteria from the numerous intestinal flora encountered in stool.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="macconkey-agar">MacConkey Agar<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#macconkey-agar" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>MacConkey agar or broth is a differential medium with low selectivity for the lactose fermenting and non-lactose fermenting bacteria. In MacConkey agar, peptone and agar form the base to which the following substances are added:</p>
<p>(i) Lactose—a fermentable carbohydrate
(ii) Bile salt (sodium taurocholate)—inhibits most Gram positive organisms.
(iii) 1% aqueous neutral red—indicator for the acidity of the medium
(iv) Sodium chloride—optional
(v) Water—solvent for all the ingredients.</p>
<p>The chemistry of MacConkey medium is that lactose fermenting organisms ferment lactose and produce lactic acid. This acid acts upon the bile salt and absorbs the neutral red and appear as a red colony. Those organisms that do not ferment lactose, do not produce acid and give alkaline reaction. They do not therefore, absorb the neutral red and produce colourless (straw-coloured) colonies.</p>
<p>MacConkey broth is used for testing water. MacConkey agar is more economically and easily prepared from the dehydrated medium.</p>
<p>Scanned by CamScanner</p>
<p>840 Bacteriology</p>
<table><thead><tr><th><strong>Note</strong></th><th>Swarming of Proteus species is inhibited by the absence of sodium chloride in the medium.</th></tr></thead></table>
<p><strong>Preparation</strong> (without salt)</p>
<ul>
<li>MacConkey agar base (oxoid) 23.5 g</li>
<li>Distilled water 500 ml</li>
<li>pH 7.4</li>
<li>Sterilise at 121°C for 15 minutes</li>
<li>Mix well</li>
<li>Pour plates as soon as it is cool enough to be handled. Label and store.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>MacConkey broth for the enumeration of Coliforms in water</strong> The MacConkey broth is prepared either as single strength or double strength. The single strength MacConkey broth is same as the MacConkey agar, minus the agar. The double strength broth has double quantities of the ingredients of the single strength except the volume of the distilled water which remains the same. The MacConkey broth is also available commercially in tablet forms.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="deoxycholate-citrate-agar-dca">DEOXYCHOLATE CITRATE AGAR (DCA)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#deoxycholate-citrate-agar-dca" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>DCA is a selective and differential medium used in the isolation of <em>Salmonella</em> and <em>Shigella</em> groups of organisms. The medium, in addition to peptone and agar, is composed of the following:</p>
<p>(i) Sodium desoxycholate (bile salt)—inhibits the growth of many Gram positive bacteria.</p>
<p>(ii) Neutral red—an indicator for the activity of the medium and is also toxic in the presence of desoxycholate</p>
<p>(iii) Sodium citrate and sodium thiosulphate—toxic for the coliforms and to some extent, for <em>Salmonella</em>.</p>
<p>(iv) Ferric citrate—neutralises this toxicity for <em>Salmonella</em> without reducing the toxicity for the coliforms. It helps in the detection of H₂S production by blackening the colony.</p>
<p>(v) Water—solvent for all the ingredients.</p>
<p>The chemistry of the DCA medium is same as for MacConkey agar. The red colonies may show precipitation due to acid production.</p>
<p>DCA is most economically prepared from the dehydrated medium which is available from many manufacturers. It is usually at a concentration of 5.2 Grams per 100 ml of distilled water.</p>
<p><strong>Preparation of DCA</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>DCA agar base 23.0 g</li>
<li>Distilled water 500 ml</li>
<li>Bring to boil over gauze and flame to dissolve completely.</li>
<li>Shake regularly to prevent charring.</li>
<li>Cool to 50°C, mix well and pour plates. Label and store.</li>
</ul>
<table><thead><tr><th><strong>Note</strong></th><th>1. When extra 2g of sodium deoxycholate is added, the medium becomes selective for <em>Yersinia enterocolitica</em>.</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td></td><td>2. The medium is heat sensitive. Do not overheat during preparation.</td></tr></tbody></table>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="cled-medium">CLED MEDIUM<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#cled-medium" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Cystine-Lactose-Electrolyte Deficient (CLED) medium is a good differential medium. It differentiates the lactose fermenting from the non-lactose fermenting organisms. Its electrolyte deficiency prevents the swarming of <em>Proteus</em> species. It is most useful for urinary bacteriology. It supports the growth of all urinary potential pathogens; and gives good colonial differentiation of isolates. It contains peptone and agar plus lactose, L-cystine and bromo-thymol-blue indicator.</p>
<p>Certain organisms ferment lactose and produce acid which turns the bromo-thymol-blue to yellow and the colonies appear yellow. The non-lactose fermenters appear as greenish blue colonies. Because of the extra enrichment with cystine, cystine-dependent <em>E. coli</em>, <em>Staphylococcus</em> species, <em>Streptococcus faecalis</em>, <em>Lactobacilli</em> and diphtheroids grow well on this medium.</p>
<p><strong>Preparation</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>CLED agar (Oxoid) 18.1 g</li>
<li>Distilled water 500 ml</li>
<li>Sterilise at 121°C for 15 minutes</li>
</ul>
<p>Scanned by CamScanner</p>
<p>Formulae and Preparation of Culture Media 841</p>
<p>Cool to 50°C</p>
<p>Mix well and pour plates. Label and store.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="selenite-f-broth-modified">SELENITE F BROTH (MODIFIED)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#selenite-f-broth-modified" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Selenite F (faeces) broth is an enrichment medium for the isolation of Salmonella species from faecal and urine specimens. Sodium hydrogen selenite (Sodium biselenite) is highly toxic for E. coli at near-neutral pH whereas the salmonellae are not affected. Buffer salts are present to help maintain the pH which may rise as the toxicity decreases. A fermentable carbohydrate (lactose) is also present to provide acid to neutralise the alkali produced when the selenite is reduced by bacteria. The constituents of selenite F broth are:</p>
<table><thead><tr><th>Sodium hydrogen selenite</th><th>4.0 g</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>Peptone</td><td>5.0 g</td></tr><tr><td>Lactose</td><td>4.0 g</td></tr><tr><td>Disodium hydrogen phosphate, anhydrous</td><td>9.5 g</td></tr><tr><td>Sodium dihydrogen phosphate</td><td>0.5 g</td></tr><tr><td>Distilled water.</td><td>1000 ml</td></tr></tbody></table>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="preparation">Preparation<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#preparation" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Heat to 75–80°C to dissolve (place container in a hot water bath).</p>
<p>The pH must be near to 7.0; if not, adjust to the correct pH.</p>
<p>Dispense in 10 ml amounts in screw-cap universal type bottles.</p>
<p>Sterilise by steaming (with caps loosened) for 20 minutes.</p>
<p>Tighten the caps. When settled a small amount of red precipitate should form at the bottom. It is a sign of correct preparation.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="note">Note<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#note" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>Sodium selenite is a highly toxic chemical with the ability to induce abnormalities in fetus (teratogenic effect). Avoid skin or mouth contact. It is not advisable for a woman of child-bearing age to prepare the medium.</li>
<li>Never autoclave the medium. Steaming for 20 minutes only is enough.</li>
<li>The small amount of red precipitate which usually forms at the bottom of the container does not interfere with the performance of the medium.</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="hektoen-enteric-agar">HEKTOEN ENTERIC AGAR<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#hektoen-enteric-agar" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>This is a differential, selective medium for the isolation of Shigella and Salmonella species from clinical specimens. It has a high carbohydrate content and low toxicity of indicator system which facilitates the recovery of Shigella and Salmonella species while inhibiting the normal enteric flora. The constituents of Hektoen medium are:</p>
<table><thead><tr><th>Proteose peptone</th><th>6.0 g</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>Yeast extract</td><td>1.5 g</td></tr><tr><td>Lactose</td><td>6.0 g</td></tr><tr><td>Sucrose</td><td>6.0 g</td></tr><tr><td>Salicin</td><td>1.0 g</td></tr><tr><td>Sodium taurocholate(Bile salt)</td><td>4.5 g</td></tr><tr><td>Sodium chloride</td><td>2.5 g</td></tr><tr><td>Ammonium ferric citrate</td><td>0.75 g</td></tr><tr><td>Sodium thiosulphate</td><td>2.5 g</td></tr><tr><td>Acid fuchsin</td><td>0.05 g</td></tr><tr><td>Bromothymol blue</td><td>0.0365 g</td></tr><tr><td>Agar</td><td>7.0 g</td></tr><tr><td>Distilled water</td><td>500 ml</td></tr><tr><td>pH 7.5</td><td></td></tr></tbody></table>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="preparation">Preparation<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#preparation" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Heat gently and bring to a boil for a few seconds to dissolve</p>
<p>(Never autoclave this medium).</p>
<p>Mix gently at intervals.</p>
<p>Allow to cool to 50°C and pour plates. Label Hek and store.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="xylose-lysine-deoxycholate-xld-agar">XYLOSE LYSINE DEOXYCHOLATE (XLD) AGAR<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#xylose-lysine-deoxycholate-xld-agar" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>This medium is used to isolate Salmonella and Shigella species. It differentiates the salmonellae and the shigellae from non-enteric pathogen in faecal specimens.</p>
<p>For a busy routine laboratory, the medium is best prepared from the dehydrated form available from commercial firms.</p>
<p>Scanned by CamScanner</p>
<p>842 Bacteriology</p>
<p>The medium contains:</p>
<table><thead><tr><th>Yeast extract</th><th>3.0 g</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>L-lysine HCl</td><td>5.0 g</td></tr><tr><td>Xylose</td><td>3.75 g</td></tr><tr><td>Lactose</td><td>7.5 g</td></tr><tr><td>Sucrose</td><td>7.5 g</td></tr><tr><td>Sodium deoxycholate</td><td>1.0 g</td></tr><tr><td>Sodium chloride</td><td>5.0 g</td></tr><tr><td>Sodium thiosulphate</td><td>6.8 g</td></tr><tr><td>Ferric ammonium citrate</td><td>0.8 g</td></tr><tr><td>Phenol red</td><td>0.08 g</td></tr><tr><td>Agar</td><td>12.5 g</td></tr><tr><td>Distilled water</td><td>1000 ml</td></tr><tr><td>pH 7.4</td><td></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p>Preparation</p>
<p>Heat gently and bring to boil
Mix gently at intervals. Do not autoclave.
Cool to 50°C and pour plates.
Label and store.</p>
<p>◆ MEDIUM FOR THE ISOLATION OF FRANCISELLA TULARENSIS (Glucose Cystine Chocolate Agar)</p>
<p>This medium contains 2.5% glucose in 0.1% cystine hydrochloride.</p>
<p>Glucose cystine solution</p>
<table><thead><tr><th>Glucose</th><th>12.5 g</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>Cystine hydrochloride</td><td>0.5 g</td></tr><tr><td>Water</td><td>50 ml</td></tr><tr><td>Sterilise the solution by filtration</td><td></td></tr><tr><td>Complete medium:</td><td></td></tr><tr><td>Cooled sterile molten nutrient agar</td><td>85 ml</td></tr><tr><td>Glucose cystine solution</td><td>10 ml</td></tr><tr><td>Human blood (fresh)</td><td>5 ml</td></tr><tr><td>Mix gently and pour plates. Label and store.</td><td></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p>◆ CULTURE MEDIA FOR FUNGI</p>
<p>Subouraud Dextrose Agar</p>
<p>Most fungi of medical importance grow well on Sabouraud dextrose agar. It is an acid pH medium that allows the growth of dermatophytes, Candida and other fungi and acidophilic bacteria. It contains:</p>
<table><thead><tr><th>Peptone (mycological)</th><th>5.0 g</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>Dextrose</td><td>20.0 g</td></tr><tr><td>Agar</td><td>7.5 g</td></tr><tr><td>Distilled water</td><td>500 ml</td></tr><tr><td>pH 5.5</td><td></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p>It is available in dehydrated powdered form or tablet form from manufacturers of culture media. The powdered form is used at a concentration of 65 g per litre of distilled water, and the tablets at 1 tablet in 5 ml of distilled water.</p>
<p>The Sabouraud medium can be made more selective when used with certain antibiotics in order to isolate pathogenic fungi from material containing large numbers of other fungi and bacteria:</p>
<p>0.5 g cycloheximide in 1 litre of medium inhibits Cryptococcus neoformans and Aspergillus fumigatus;</p>
<p>20,000 units penicillin and 40,000 units streptomycin in 1 litre of medium inhibits Actinomyces bovis and Nocardia aesteroides;</p>
<p>0.4 g chloramphenicol in 1 litre of medium can also inhibit most of the unwanted bacteria.</p>
<p>Preparation of the medium</p>
<p>Sterilise at 121°C for 15 minutes
Cool to 50°C</p>
<p>Chloramphenicol solution (100g/litre) 2.0 ml
Mix well and pour plates; or dispense aseptically in 7-10 ml volumes in sterile tubes and allow to set in sloped position.</p>
<p>Preparation of chloramphenicol solution (Park-Davies Chloramphenicol sodium succinate-1.2 g)</p>
<ol>
<li>Aseptically, add 2 ml of sterile distilled water to the chloramphenicol powder. Mix gently to dissolve the powder.</li>
<li>Transfer to a sterile universal container.</li>
<li>Add 10 ml of sterile distilled water and mix.</li>
<li>Aseptically, distribute in 2 ml amounts into appropriate sterile containers.</li>
<li>Store frozen.</li>
</ol>
<p>Each 2 ml volume is sufficient for 500 ml of Sabouraud's agar medium. The final concentration is 0.4 mg/ml.</p>
<p>Scanned by CamScanner</p>
<p>Formulae and Preparation of Culture Media 843</p>
<p>In place of dextrose other carbohydrates such as maltose and salicin can be used with or without antibiotics.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="corn-meal-agar">Corn Meal Agar<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#corn-meal-agar" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Corn meal agar is a useful mycological medium which is used for the production of chlamydospores by <em>Candida albicans</em>. It is also useful as a stock maintenance medium because it is a nutritionally deprived medium.</p>
<p>The medium is available in dehydrated powdered form or tablet form.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="preparation">Preparation<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#preparation" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>

<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="tablet">Tablet<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#tablet" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>

<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="c6adcb66">♦ CULTURE MEDIA FOR HAEMOPHILUS SPECIES<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#c6adcb66" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="levinthal-agar">Levinthal Agar<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#levinthal-agar" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<p>This is a plate medium used to demonstrate the iridescence of capsulated strains of <em>Haemophilus influenzae</em>. It is a chocolated blood agar but here whole horse blood is used. The horse blood is used at 5% concentration.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="preparation">Preparation<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#preparation" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<p>Add blood to sterile molten nutrient agar.</p>
<p>Heat in a container of boiling water until the blood is chocolated.</p>
<p>Allow the sediment to settle. Alternatively, it can be filtered aseptically.</p>
<p>Pour the clear supernatant fluid (or filtrate) in sterile petri dishes. Label and store.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="c206d187">♦ BACITRACIN CHOCOLATE AGAR<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#c206d187" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>

<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="tomato-juice-agar">Tomato Juice Agar<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#tomato-juice-agar" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
